result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian James Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Probation to commence after defendant has completed sentence on COUNT 2.

miscConds.notes: *Restitution set at $7,500.00 payable to Roland Machinery, joint/several with Kyle Orr 15CF1014 and Jerek Stys 15CF1015.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied to restitution owed.  Remaining balance to be paid during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, restitution is to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

*Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon  he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.

*7/12/16 Order signed.  To read No VIOLENT contact with Rebecca N.
*No alcohol or illegal drugs .
*No driving a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
*No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

*Cooperate with agent.
*Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
*Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision.
*Court does not allow for expungement.
*Pay all supervision fees.

*AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: *Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes:
*First 5 MONTHS straight time, remaining 5 MONTHS with release privileges to the Day Reporting Center.  If defendant does not want to cooperate with the Day Reporting Center sentence shall be served straight time, with credit for 32 days time served.
**09-15-16/Defendant is eligible for release to the Day Reporting Center on October 25, 2016.

Court waived DNA sample due to DNA sample assessed on count one. Defendant to pay the mandatory surcharges during term of probation on count one.
Court waived Court costs and surcharges as defendant is paying costs, surcharge and a large amount of restitution on count one.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Brian James Nelson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to COUNT 2.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION, for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
-Probation to commence after defendant has completed sentence on COUNT 2.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $7,500.00 payable to Roland Machinery, joint/several with Kyle Orr 15CF1014 and Jerek Stys 15CF1015.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied to restitution owed.  Remaining balance to be paid during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, restitution is to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No contact with Rebecca N. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or illegal drugs 
-Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service
-No driving a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
-Court does not allow for expungement

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, first 5 MONTHS straight time, remaining 5 MONTHS with release privileges to the Day Reporting Center.  If defendant does not want to cooperate with the Day Reporting Center sentence shall be served straight time, with credit for 32 days time served.
  
-Court waived DNA sample due to DNA sample assessed on COUNT 1.  Defendant to pay the mandatory surcharges during term of probation on COUNT 1.
-Court waived Court costs, and surcharges as defendant is paying costs, surcharge and a large amount of restitution on COUNT 1.    

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet

Defendant Brian James Nelson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Brian James Nelson in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defendant has a new felony case pending and  request an adjournment.  Court grants one last adjournment.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian James Nelson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Brian James Nelson in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State requests an adjournment as defendant was just arrested on a child abuse charge.  Matter adjourned for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
LETTER FROM MOTHER OF THE DEFENDANT.  FILED BY CINDY PAPKA. kl

Defendant Brian James Nelson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial. Court vacates the jury trial scheduled for 5/2/2016. 

As to Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. 

As to Count 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 3 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing. 

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian James Nelson in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  State's offer placed on the record.  Defendant rejects State's offer.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Plea hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
